name: NEW Low-Profile RogueMechanic Campagnolo Ultra-Torque Shim Kit
description:
:::: Now Available! New Low-Profile Shim Kit! :::: Here's the Shim Kit that I came up with for the RogueMechanic Waveywasherectomy Procedure. Kit contains the following stainless steel shims: 2- 1.0mm, 2- 0.5mm, 2- 0.2mm, 2-0.1mm. Made in U.S.A. Available for both English and Italian bottom brackets.
NEW!!!---->Installation Video
Check out www.roguemechanic.com for instructions and other info.

name: Mavic Freehub Pawls and Springs
description:
These pawls are for all ROAD and MTB FTS-L hubs marketed since September 2000. The new 2-part pawls for mountain hubs wear less quickly than the previous pawls. It is pawl wear that was mainly responsible for prematurely wearing internal components. The "road" version is single piece (no red pawl carrier)...but for the record, the "MTB" kit is compatible with road wheels. Both kits contain two pawls and springs.

MTB Mavic Part#: 324 303 01

Road Mavic Part#: M40578

name: Mavic Freehub Body Seal
description: This is the Mavic Freehub body Lip Seal.  It is compatible with both FTS-L and FTS-X Hubs.  Mavic Part Number: 955 000 01.

name: Mavic Shimano 9/10/M11 Freehub Body Road - M40592 / 308 711 01
description:
This is the Mavic freehub body that is needed for Mavic road wheels for Shimano and SRAM Road 9 and 10 speed cassettes.
This freehub body also fits the following MTB wheels: Crosstrail and Crossride....Not to be too confusing!
Mavic Part# M40592

UPDATED FOR 2013: Mavic "updated" the M40592 to part #: 308 711 01. This FHB includes a spacer to be used with 9mm axles and a shouldered spacer/reducer for use with 8mm axles.

name: Mavic Campagnolo 9/10 Freehub Body - M40591 / 308 712 01
description:
This is the Mavic freehub body that is needed for Campy 9/10/11 speed cassettes.
Mavic Part# M40591

name: Mavic Shimano/SRAM Freehub Body for Mountain - M40580
description:
This is the Mavic freehub body that is needed for Shimano/SRAM Most Mavic Mountain wheels. This fits the following hubs: CrossMax, Crossmax 29", Crossmax ST, Crossmax SX (Not Crossmax SX 09), Deetraks (not 09).
Mavic Part# M40580.
For Mavic MTB wheels with FTS-L or FTS-X (will not work with FTS hubs which were offered 2000 and before)

name: Light Mineral Oil for Mavic Freehub, 10ml
description: This is technical grade light mineral oil that is recommended by Mavic to be used to internally lubricate the freehub body, seal, as well as the pawls and springs.

name: Campagnolo Freehub Body for OS Cutout Axle - 9/10/11-Speed
description:
This is a Campagnolo one piece freehub body for OS cutout axle rear hubs. It's also compatible with Fulcrum hubs using the same OS cutout axle.

Fits Campy 9/10/11 speed cassettes.

MFR Part#: FH-BO015

This part is new and never installed. Was removed from factory packaging for photos. What you see in the second photo is genuine Campagnolo factory grease.

name: Zipp Speed Weaponry 182 Freehub Body (2005-2008) Campagnolo 9/10-Speed
description:
This is a Zipp Speed Weaponry 182 Freehub Body for Campagnolo 9/10 Speed. Fits road hubs from 2005-2008 with woven carbon hub caps Add a second 0.25mm washer for Campy 11 speed

Zipp ProductID: 111915056010

Fits: 182 Zipp Hubs (2005-2008)

Includes one of the .25mm spacers.

name: Mavic R-SYS , R-SYS SLR/ Ksyrium SR (TRACOMP) (2011,12, and 2013)
description:
These wheels use a Zircal drive side spokes and Tracomp non-drive side and front spokes. The Mavic TraComp tubular carbon spoke used in the 2011 and 2012 Mavic R-SYS wheels on the non-drive side of the rear wheel as well as the front wheel. These spokes have the new N7 nipple and thus requires the new M7 truing tool. These are far from traditional spokes are require a specific procedure to replace and to true a wheel. Your lack of following the instructions set forth by Mavic will likely result in damaging the spoke and having to by another replacement... Consider yourself warned! Since these spokes are susceptible to damage in shipping, I take special care packaging then for shipping.

Note: The Tracomp spokes for this model year have black ends.

These spokes are for the following wheels:

2011 R-SYS Clincher Version
2011 Ksyrium SR Clincher Version
2012 R-SYS Clincher Version

Lengths:
Front: 285mm
Drive Side: 294.5mm
Non-Drive Side: 283.7mm

Mavic Part #'s:
Front: 120-296-01
Drive Side: 120-294-01
Non-Drive Side: 120-295-01

name: USED Ksyrium SL REAR Rim, Silver, 324 172 13
description:
This is a USED Mavic Ksyrium SL REAR rim that when I properly disassembled the wheel was round and true. This rim has only approx 500 miles on it and show cosmetic marks from normal usage. I carefully inspected this rim and found it visually to be structurally sound.
This rear rim is specifically for the 2006-2007 model year wheel but is also compatible with 2004-2005 Ksyrium SL rear wheels. This rim has the FORE drilling, and is 20 hole.

Mavic Part #: 324 172 13
Color: Silver
Drilling: 20 hole

name: Mavic Ksyrium SL Front Rim, Silver, 324 172 10
description:
This is a Mavic Ksyrium SL front rim specifically for the 2006-2007 model year wheel but is also compatible with 2004-2005 Ksyrium SL front wheels. This rim is silver, has the FORE drilling, and is 18 hole.

Mavic Part #: 324 172 01

2009 Ksyrium SL
2010 Ksyrium SL

Mavic Part #: 996 054 13

Email me with country/city for a international shipping estimate.

name: Mavic Aluminum Spoke Tool-**NEW M7** 996 079 01
description:
These are the spoke wrenches that I use when truing most Mavic wheels (2011 and newer). 
These alloy star shaped Mavic spoke wrenches are to be used with the the "New M7" which is specifically for the newest version of the M7 nipple. This includes the Tracomp spokes as well as the 2011 and newer Zircal spokes.

name: Mavic Aluminum Spoke Tool for M7 Pre-2011 M40652
description:
This is the spoke wrench that I use when truing Mavic wheels that have the M7 style spoke nipples for wheels prior to 2011. This star shaped alloy tool is for all spokes with M7 nipples prior to 2011.

Mavic part #: M40652

name: Mavic Spoke Tool M7 Nylon
description: This is the spoke wrench that came with your pre 2011 Mavic wheels that have the M7 style spoke nipples. This star shaped plastic tool is for all spokes with M7 nipples prior to 2011 and is sufficient for light truing jobs and will last for quite some time unless you are dealing with frozen or really tight M7 nipples...they tend to strip if you put too much into it... Bottom line is if you want to get one that will last, get the aluminum version (M40652).

name: Mavic Bladed Spoke Tool - M40567
description:
This tool is used to hold bladed spokes while truing. It prevents the spoke from spinning when turning the spoke nipple. Can be used with virtually any bladed spoke.

Mavic Part #: M40567

name: Mavic Hub Wrench and Tire Lever - M40123/325 423 01
description:
This handy tool is used to adjust the bearing play on Mavic QRM+ hubs. Additionally, the other end is a nice quality tire lever.

The tried and true M40123 tool has been updated to also allow you to true wheels that have the new M7 nipples and it also has a bladed spoke tool feature (you use it to stop bladed spokes from spinning during truing). The new part number is 325 423 01.

name: Mavic TraComp Ring Tool (996 080 01)
description:
This tool used to remove and then reinstall TraComp rings.

Mavic Part #: 996 080 01

name: Mavic Rear Axle Bolt Screw M10/ED10 - 324 130 01
description:
This is the driveside axle bolt/screw that fits several Mavic road rear hubs including but not limited to Ksyrium SL, Ksyrium Elite, and Cosmic Carbone.

For M10 and ED10 hubs.

Mavic Part #: 324 130 01

name: Mavic M40660 Bearing Set
description: This bearing set includes two bearings: 6001 (28 X 12 X 8) and 608 (22 X 8 X 7).  This bearing set is used in quite a few Mavic rear wheels including, but not limited to some Ksyrium SL, Elite, Equipe, Cosmos, and Cosmic's.

name: Mavic M40075 Bearing Set
description:
This bearing set includes two bearings:
6903 (30 X 17 X 7) and 608 (22 X 8 X 7).

name: Mavic M40077 Bearing Set
description: This bearing set includes two bearings: 6901 (24 X 12 X 6) and 608 (22 X 8 X 7).

name: Mavic M40078 Bearing Set
description: This bearing set includes two 6901 (28 X 12 X 8) bearings.

name: Mavic M40076 Bearing Set
description: This bearing set includes two 6903 bearings:  (30 X 17 X 7)

name: Mavic Front Axle M40052
description:
This front axle is used in several Mavic front hubs including but not limited to:

Ksyrium ES
Ksyrium SL
Ksyrium Elite
Cosmic Carbone SL

Mavic Part #: M40052

name: Mavic M40667 Rear Axle Assembly (Ksyrium SL 2004-07)
description:
This is a barely used Mavic rear axle assembly that includes part numbers: M40667, M40676, and 234 130 01.

Fits Ksyrium SL rear hubs from 2004 thru 2007. Might even fit older Ksyrium SL models. Check to be sure.

name: Mavic Expandible Bearing Support
description:
This is, to quote Mavic, "Expansible Bearings Support" parts for Ksyrium Equipe wheels and others. Sold as pairs.

Mavic Part #: 323 484 01

name: Mavic TraComp Ring and Clips 996 938 01
description:
This is a pair of replacement rings and clips for R-SYS wheels with TraComp Spokes.

Mavic Part #: 996 938 01

From Mavic tech:
With the R-Sys Tracomp concept, the nipple and the tubular spoke are fixed together. Thus, when turning the nipple of a tubular spoke, the spoke itself turns along its entire length (nipple, tube and head).

CONSEQUENTLY, BEFORE TURNING THE NIPPLE OF A TUBULAR SPOKE (TRUING, REPLACING A SPOKE, REPLACING A RIM), THE TRACOMP RING MUST FIRST BE REMOVED FROM THE HUB.

name: RogueMechanic T Shirt v.1
description: I FINALLY had some t-shirts made. Typical me, I couldn't go with just regular quality t-shirts, I went with higher quality shirts from American Apparel. With quality comes cost. These are great shirts and come with the v1 logo. Keep in mind that this are fitted, which means they run small. American Apparel Fitted T Material: 5.8 oz., 100% superfine ribbed cotton. Product Description: Double needle hems. Taped neck and shoulder seams. Luxurious fabric. Comments: Runs small and is fitted. Made in the USA. Click here for sizing info.
